content.description: The crux is definitely at the top...just trying to find the right moves to top out over a somewhat sketchy landing.
content.protection: Pads and good spotters. There are a couple of larger rocks underneath.
content.location:
Start on the same as

Meddlesome

problem. Reach to the lip and head left. There are some slopers as you head up. Get a high right foot on the lip to top out.

content.description: Stand start from a left, three finger pocket and a right, sloping shelf, move up to a large left jug and work the lip right to a nice pocket which accesses the diagonal shelf at the top, and walk off the back side.
content.protection: A few pads and a spot, there are rocks and cacti in the area but overall good landings.
content.location: This is on the southeast face of Bondi Boulder.

content.description: Sit start with your left hand on a small arete feature (in tan rock) and your right hand on a sidepull (in black rock). Make a big move to a jug, and then work a rail back to the left. Do a left hand bump to a bad sloper as an intermediate or move your left hand all the way to a good pocket. Finish on good but sandy/dirty holds and good footholds.
content.location: Start on a tan streak on the right side of the boulder.

content.description:
This is a sit start to

Meddlesome

. Simply sit and follow the

Meddlesome

problem to the top.
content.location: Start with a right hand on a crimp and left hand on a two finger hueco. Move up and out!
